snippet: Many tests and procedures have been oversold, their benefits exaggerated and their harms ignored.
abstract: Essay by doctors Lisa M Schwartz and Steven Woloshin argues against excessive medical testing, saying that many tests have been oversold, their benefits exaggerated and their harms ignored.

byline.original: By LISA M. SCHWARTZ, M.D. and STEVEN WOLOSHIN, M.D

lead_paragraph: Many tests and procedures have been oversold, their benefits exaggerated and their harms ignored.

headline.main: Endless Screenings Don’t Bring Everlasting Health
headline.print_headline: Endless Screenings Don’t Bring Everlasting Health
